arts.sum: Ray Parlour thinks Wolves will score in a defeat to Tottenham Despite Wolves being unbeaten in their last five meetings with Spurs and boasting an impressive record at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium, the hosts are strong favourites due to their impressive form this season.

We’re third in the division, with the only goal difference separating us from Arsenal in the second slot, and 5 points keeping Liverpool in pole position. arts.ttl: Thomas Frank feels ‘nothing is going to be easy’ against Wolves
arts.sum: “It's a team we haven't been able to beat the last five times, so we're aware this is another game in the Premier League where you can take nothing for granted, you can't be thinking you can walk over any opponents. I've been these questions before in the past, and I was thinking, is it best to face a team that's unbeaten in 10 or a team that haven't won in 10?

arts.sum: Tottenham Hotspur host struggling Wolverhampton Wanderers this evening as they aim to return to winning ways in the Premier League after last week's draw at Brighton

arts.ttl: Wolves XI vs Tottenham Hotspur – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Wolves travel to Tottenham on Saturday on the brink of unwanted history. Vítor Pereira’s side have lost all five of their Premier League games this season. A sixth consecutive defeat would see them become only the fourth team in the competition’s history to start a campaign in such a disastrous fashion. arts.sum: Tottenham Hotspur will aim to continue their strong start to the season on Saturday when they host a crisis-ridden Wolverhampton Wanderers side at the bottom of the table. arts.ttl: Spurs v Wolves preview: Vitor Pereira ready to kickstart season
arts.sum: Pereira, who played a back four in that game and remained coy on which system he will utilise moving forward, now believes it is time for his side to start their season properly as they travel to the capital. "I feel the squad is more balanced than last season because we have two players for each position," Pereira said.
